BiblioData.Title: FUNCTIONALIZED CELLULOSE - CARBON NANOTUBE NANOCOMPOSITES AND HYBRIDE MATERIALS
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention provides nanocomposite and hybride materials both comprising functionalized carbon nanotubes (202-205) and cellulose (201) or functionalized cellulose as well as methods of fabricating these materials. The hybride material also comprises a cross-linking reagent to cross-link the nanotubes and cellulose. In addition, polymer materials and an aerogel all containing the nanocomposite or the hybride material are disclosed. The described nanocomposites are strong and electrically conducting, and have many materials and electronic applications, such as supercapacitors.

Claims.P: Claims
1. A nanocomposite that contains cellulose or funtionalized cellulose and functionalized carbon nanotubes.
2. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 that is made of single walled carbon nanotubes.
3. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 that is made of multi walled carbon nanotubes.

4. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 , in which the functionalized cellulose is cellulose acetate, cellulose acetate propionate, nitrocellulose, carboxymethyl cellulose, or dimethylamide of carboxymethyl cellulose.
5. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 , in which the functionalized carbon nanotubes contain carboxyl, sulfonyl, nitro, amino, hydratsino, and/or hydroxyl functionalities.
6. A nanocomposite of claim 1 that is made by pulp cooking methods in the presence of functionalized carbon nanotubes.

7. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 that is made by solubilizing cellulose as xanthate, Cu(II) complex, or urethane, mixing functionalized carbon nanotubes with this solution, and codepositing cellulose and functionalized carbon nanotubes.
8. A nanocomposite of Claim 1 that is made by solubilizing cellulose and functionalized carbon nanotubes into isothiocyanate water solution at temperatures over 120 <0>C.

9. A hybride material that is made by cross-linking the nanocomposite of Claim 1 with a reagent that is able to cross-link either cellulose or functionalized cellulose and/or functionalized carbon nanotubes.
10. A hybride material of Claim 6, in which the said cross-linking reagent contains epoxy, isocyanate, or active ester functionalities.
11. A hybride material of Claim 6, in which the said cross-linking reagent is cyanuric chloride, tetra-alcoxy silane, metal alcoholate, or boric acid.
12. A hybride material of Claim 6, in which the cross-linking material is a metal atom or metal cluster.
13. A polymer that contains nanocomposite of claim 1
14. A polymer that contains hybride material of claim 9.
15. An aerogel that contains hybride material of Claim 9.
16. A supercapacitor that is made of nanocomposite of Claim 1.
17. A supercapacitor that is made of hybride material of Claim 9.
18. A supercapacitor of Claim 16, in which conducting nanoparticles are in contact with functionalized carbon nanotubes.
19. A supercapacitor of Claim 17, in which the said conducting nanoparticles have been chemically bound with functionalized carbon nanotubes.
20. A supercapacitor of Claim 19, in which the electrolyte solution can flow through, and be in contact with the said functionalized carbon nanotubes and conducting nanoparticles.
